column1: informal statement If $x$ is an integer, then $x^n$ is an $n$th power. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_nth_power [simp, intro]: "is_nth_power n (x ^ n)"
informal statement If $x = y^n$, then $x$ is an $n$th power. formal statement lemma is_nth_powerI [intro?]: "x = y ^ n \<Longrightarrow> is_nth_power n x"

informal statement If $x$ is an $n$th power, then there exists $y$ such that $x = y^n$. formal statement lemma is_nth_powerE: "is_nth_power n x \<Longrightarrow> (\<And>y. x = y ^ n \<Longrightarrow> P) \<Longrightarrow> P"
informal statement A number $x$ is a zeroth power if and only if $x = 1$. formal statement lemma is_zeroth_power [simp]: "is_nth_power 0 x \<longleftrightarrow> x = 1"
informal statement $1$ is the first power of any number. formal statement lemma is_first_power [simp]: "is_nth_power 1 x"
informal statement The first power of any number is itself. formal statement lemma is_first_power' [simp]: "is_nth_power (Suc 0) x"
informal statement If $n$ is a positive integer, then $0$ is an $n$th power. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_0 [simp]: "n > 0 \<Longrightarrow> is_nth_power n (0 :: 'a :: semiring_1)"

informal statement A number is an $n$th power if and only if it is zero and $n > 0$. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_0_iff [simp]: "is_nth_power n (0 :: 'a :: semiring_1) \<longleftrightarrow> n > 0"
informal statement $1$ is an $n$th power. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_1 [simp]: "is_nth_power n 1"
informal statement The number $1$ is an $n$th power. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_Suc_0 [simp]: "is_nth_power n (Suc 0)"

informal statement If $n$ is a positive integer, then $x$ is an $n$th power if and only if $n$ divides the multiplicity of $p$ in $x$ for every prime $p$. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_conv_multiplicity: fixes x :: "'a :: {factorial_semiring, normalization_semidom_multiplicative}" assumes "n > 0" shows "is_nth_power n (normalize x) \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>p. prime p \<longrightarrow> n dvd multiplicity p x)"

informal statement If $n$ is a positive integer, then $x$ is an $n$th power if and only if $n$ divides the multiplicity of $p$ in $x$ for every prime $p$. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_conv_multiplicity_nat: assumes "n > 0" shows "is_nth_power n (x :: nat) \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>p. prime p \<longrightarrow> n dvd multiplicity p x)"

informal statement If $a$ and $b$ are $n$th powers, then $a \cdot b$ is an $n$th power. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_mult: assumes "is_nth_power n a" "is_nth_power n b" shows "is_nth_power n (a * b :: 'a :: comm_monoid_mult)"

informal statement If $a$ and $b$ are coprime and $a b$ is an $n$th power, then $a$ and $b$ are $n$th powers. formal statement lemma is_nth_power_mult_coprime_natD: fixes a b :: nat assumes "coprime a b" "is_nth_power n (a * b)" "a > 0" "b > 0" shows "is_nth_power n a" "is_nth_power n b"
